name: AnalyzeTrace
author: Ziad S. Saad SSCC/NIMH/NIH
description: A program to analyze SUMA (and AFNI's perhaps) stack output for functions that return with RETURN without bothering to go on the stack.

inputs.description: Trace output file obtained by redirecting the program’s trace output.
inputs.name: Trace output file

inputs.description: Set the maximum number of code lines before a function returns. Default is no limit.
inputs.name: Maximum function lines

inputs.description: FILE is a SUMA_*.c file. It is analyzed for functions that use SUMA_RETURN without ENTRY.
inputs.name: SUMA C file

inputs.description: Stop after encountering MAX_ERR errors reported in log. Default is 5. Error key terms are: 'Error', 'error', 'corruption'.
inputs.name: Maximum errors

inputs.description: Ignore any Rotate, Volreg, Tagalign, or WarpDrive transformations present in the Surface Volume.
inputs.name: Ignore volume registration

inputs.description: Set environment variable ENVname to be ENVvalue. Quotes are necessary.
inputs.name: Set environment variable

inputs.description: Turns on In/Out debug and Memory tracing.
inputs.name: Trace flag
